overview: Mysore, officially Mysuru, is the second‑most populous city in Karnataka and the state’s cultural capital. Historically the seat of the Wodeyar dynasty, it is known for its well‑planned layout, cleanliness and a blend of heritage sites such as palaces and temples with modern amenities.
bestTimeToVisit: November to February (cool, dry winter season)
topAttractions: Chamundi Hill (site of the Mahishasura statue and Chamundeshwari Temple)
Mysore Zoo (one of the oldest zoos in India)
travelTips: Fly into Mysore Airport (MYQ) for regional connections or use Bangalore International Airport (BLR) 185 km away and take a train or bus.
Travel by train to Mysore Junction for affordable long‑distance connections, especially from Bangalore.
Use auto‑rickshaws and city buses for inexpensive local transport; they are widely available.
Visit attractions in the cooler winter months to avoid the hot summer and heavy monsoon rains.
Dress modestly when visiting religious sites such as Chamundi Hill and carry a water bottle to stay hydrated.
